info.title: Azure Communication Service Call Automation APIs
info.description: Azure Communication Service Call Automation APIs

post.summary: Create an outbound call.
post.description: Create an outbound call.

parameters.name: Repeatability-Request-ID
parameters.description: If specified, the client directs that the request is repeatable; that is, that the client can make the request multiple times with the same Repeatability-Request-Id and get back an appropriate response without the server executing the request multiple times. The value of the Repeatability-Request-Id is an opaque string representing a client-generated unique identifier for the request. It is a version 4 (random) UUID.

parameters.name: Repeatability-First-Sent
parameters.description: If Repeatability-Request-ID header is specified, then Repeatability-First-Sent header must also be specified. The value should be the date and time at which the request was first created, expressed using the IMF-fixdate form of HTTP-date. Example: Sun, 06 Nov 1994 08:49:37 GMT.

201.description: Returns details of the call properties once the CreateCall request is received by service. You will receive CallConnected event at your specified callback URI, once the call is connected.

post.summary: Answer a Call.
post.description: Answer a call using the IncomingCallContext from Event Grid.

parameters.name: Repeatability-Request-ID
parameters.description: If specified, the client directs that the request is repeatable; that is, that the client can make the request multiple times with the same Repeatability-Request-Id and get back an appropriate response without the server executing the request multiple times. The value of the Repeatability-Request-Id is an opaque string representing a client-generated unique identifier for the request. It is a version 4 (random) UUID.

parameters.name: Repeatability-First-Sent
parameters.description: If Repeatability-Request-ID header is specified, then Repeatability-First-Sent header must also be specified. The value should be the date and time at which the request was first created, expressed using the IMF-fixdate form of HTTP-date. Example: Sun, 06 Nov 1994 08:49:37 GMT.

200.description: Returns details of the call properties once the AnswerCall request is received by service. You will receive CallConnected event at your specified callback URI, once the call is connected.

post.summary: Redirect a call.
post.description: Redirect a call.

parameters.name: Repeatability-Request-ID
parameters.description: If specified, the client directs that the request is repeatable; that is, that the client can make the request multiple times with the same Repeatability-Request-Id and get back an appropriate response without the server executing the request multiple times. The value of the Repeatability-Request-Id is an opaque string representing a client-generated unique identifier for the request. It is a version 4 (random) UUID.

parameters.name: Repeatability-First-Sent
parameters.description: If Repeatability-Request-ID header is specified, then Repeatability-First-Sent header must also be specified. The value should be the date and time at which the request was first created, expressed using the IMF-fixdate form of HTTP-date. Example: Sun, 06 Nov 1994 08:49:37 GMT.

204.description: The service has redirected the call to specified endpoint.

post.summary: Reject the call.
post.description: Reject the call.

parameters.name: Repeatability-Request-ID
parameters.description: If specified, the client directs that the request is repeatable; that is, that the client can make the request multiple times with the same Repeatability-Request-Id and get back an appropriate response without the server executing the request multiple times. The value of the Repeatability-Request-Id is an opaque string representing a client-generated unique identifier for the request. It is a version 4 (random) UUID.

parameters.name: Repeatability-First-Sent
parameters.description: If Repeatability-Request-ID header is specified, then Repeatability-First-Sent header must also be specified. The value should be the date and time at which the request was first created, expressed using the IMF-fixdate form of HTTP-date. Example: Sun, 06 Nov 1994 08:49:37 GMT.

204.description: The service has rejected the call.

post.summary: Create a Connection to a CallLocator.
post.description: Create a connection to a CallLocator.

parameters.name: Repeatability-Request-ID
parameters.description: If specified, the client directs that the request is repeatable; that is, that the client can make the request multiple times with the same Repeatability-Request-Id and get back an appropriate response without the server executing the request multiple times. get.summary: Get the detail properties of an ongoing call.

200.description: Returns details of the call properties.

delete.summary: Hang up call automation service from the call. This will make call automation service leave the call, but does not terminate if there are more than 1 caller in the call.
delete.description: Hang up call automation service from the call. This will make call automation service leave the call, but does not terminate if there are more than 1 caller in the call.

204.description: Call automation service has left the call.

post.summary: Terminate a call using CallConnectionId.
post.description: Terminate a call using CallConnectionId.

parameters.name: Repeatability-Request-ID
parameters.description: If specified, the client directs that the request is repeatable; that is, that the client can make the request multiple times with the same Repeatability-Request-Id and get back an appropriate response without the server executing the request multiple times. The value of the Repeatability-Request-Id is an opaque string representing a client-generated unique identifier for the request. It is a version 4 (random) UUID.

parameters.name: Repeatability-First-Sent
parameters.description: If Repeatability-Request-ID header is specified, then Repeatability-First-Sent header must also be specified. The value should be the date and time at which the request was first created, expressed using the IMF-fixdate form of HTTP-date. Example: Sun, 06 Nov 1994 08:49:37 GMT.

post.summary: Transfer the call to a participant.
post.description: Transfer the call to a participant.

parameters.name: Repeatability-Request-ID
parameters.description: If specified, the client directs that the request is repeatable; that is, that the client can make the request multiple times with the same Repeatability-Request-Id and get back an appropriate response without the server executing the request multiple times. The value of the Repeatability-Request-Id is an opaque string representing a client-generated unique identifier for the request. It is a version 4 (random) UUID.

parameters.name: Repeatability-First-Sent
parameters.description: If Repeatability-Request-ID header is specified, then Repeatability-First-Sent header must also be specified. The value should be the date and time at which the request was first created, expressed using the IMF-fixdate form of HTTP-date. Example: Sun, 06 Nov 1994 08:49:37 GMT.

202.description: The service has accepted the transfer request and will begin processing it. You will receive either CallTransferAccepted or CallTransferFailed event at your specified callback URI to update you on the status of the request.

post.summary: Plays audio to participants in the call.
post.description: Plays audio to participants in the call.

202.description: The service has accepted the play request and will begin processing it. You will receive either PlayCompleted or PlayFailed event at your specified callback URI to update you on the status of the request.

post.summary: Starts transcription in the call
post.description: Starts transcription in the call

202.description: The service has accepted the start transcription request and will begin processing it. You will receive either TranscriptionStarted or TranscriptionFailed event at your specified callback URI to update you on the status of the request.

post.summary: Stops transcription in the call.
post.description: Stops transcription in the call.

202.description: The service has accepted the stop transcription request and will begin processing it. You will receive either TranscriptionStopped event at your specified callback URI to update you on the status of the request.

post.summary: Cancel all media operations in a call.
post.description: Cancel all media operations in a call.

202.description: The service has accepted the cancel request and will begin processing it. You will receive the RecognizeCanceled and/or PlayCanceled event at your specified callback URI to update you on the status of the request, based on which media operation has been canceled by it.

post.summary: Recognize media from call.
post.description: Recognize media from call.

202.description: The service has accepted the recognize request and will begin processing it. You will receive either RecognizeCompleted or RecognizeFailed event at your specified callback URI to update you on the status of the request.

post.summary: Start continuous Dtmf recognition by subscribing to tones.

200.description: The service has started continuous dtmf recognition. You will receive either the ContinuousDtmfRecognitionToneReceived, ContinuousDtmfRecognitionToneFailed or ContinuousDtmfRecognitionStopped event at your specified callback URI. Continuous dtmf recognition can run in parallel with other media operations. For example if the Recognize operation is also active and a dtmf is detected, both ContinuousDtmfRecognitionToneReceived and RecognizeCompleted events will be received.

post.summary: Stop continuous Dtmf recognition by unsubscribing to tones.

200.description: The service has stopped continuous dtmf recognition. If continuous dtmf recognition was previously started, you will receive the ContinuousDtmfRecognitionStopped event at your specified callback URI.

post.summary: Send dtmf tones.
post.description: Send dtmf tones.

parameters.name: Repeatability-Request-ID
parameters.description: If specified, the client directs that the request is repeatable; that is, that the client can make the request multiple times with the same Repeatability-Request-Id and get back an appropriate response without the server executing the request multiple times. The value of the Repeatability-Request-Id is an opaque string representing a client-generated unique identifier for the request. It is a version 4 (random) UUID.

parameters.name: Repeatability-First-Sent
parameters.description: If Repeatability-Request-ID header is specified, then Repeatability-First-Sent header must also be specified. The value should be the date and time at which the request was first created, expressed using the IMF-fixdate form of HTTP-date. Example: Sun, 06 Nov 1994 08:49:37 GMT.

202.description: The service has accepted the send dtmf tones request and will begin processing it. You will receive either the SendDtmfTonesCompleted or the SendDtmfTonesFailed event at your specified callback URI to update you on the status of the request.

post.summary: UpdateTranscription Api.
post.description: API to change transcription language.

post.summary: Hold participant from the call using identifier.
post.description: Hold participant from the call using identifier.

parameters.name: holdRequest
parameters.description: The participants to be hold from the call.

post.summary: Unhold participants from the call using identifier.
post.description: Unhold participants from the call using identifier.

parameters.name: unholdRequest
parameters.description: The participants to be hold from the call.

post.summary: Starts media streaming in the call
post.description: Starts media streaming in the call.

202.description: The service has accepted the start media streaming request and will begin processing it. You will receive either MediaStreamingStarted or MediaStreamingFailed event at your specified callback URI to update you on the status of the request.

post.summary: Stops media streaming in the call
post.description: Stops media streaming in the call.

202.description: The service has accepted the stop media streaming request and will begin processing it. You will receive either MediaStreamingStopped or MediaStreamingFailed event at your specified callback URI to update you on the status of the request.

post.summary: Plays audio to participants in the call.
post.description: Plays audio to participants in the call.

202.description: The service has accepted the interrupt audio request and will begin processing it. You will receive either PlayCompleted or PlayFailed event at your specified callback URI to update you on the status of the request.

put.summary: Start a dialog targeting a particular participant on the call.

204.description: Returns no content for stop dialog response.

patch.summary: Update an ongoing dialog in a call.

get.summary: Get participants from a call. Recording and transcription bots are omitted from this list.
get.description: Get participants from a call. Recording and transcription bots are omitted from this list.

200.description: Returns the detail of the requested participant.

post.summary: Start recording the call.

parameters.name: startCallRecording
parameters.description: The request body of start call recording request.

parameters.name: Repeatability-Request-ID
parameters.description: If specified, the client directs that the request is repeatable; that is, that the client can make the request multiple times with the same Repeatability-Request-Id and get back an appropriate response without the server executing the request multiple times. The value of the Repeatability-Request-Id is an opaque string representing a client-generated unique identifier for the request. It is a version 4 (random) UUID.

parameters.description: If Repeatability-Request-ID header is specified, then Repeatability-First-Sent header must also be specified. The value should be the date and time at which the request was first created, expressed using the IMF-fixdate form of HTTP-date. Example: Sun, 06 Nov 1994 08:49:37 GMT.

200.description: Returns the start call recording response.

202.description: The service has accepted the StartCallRecording request and will begin processing it. You will receive either a StartRecordingFailed event or RecordingStateChanged event at your specified callback URI to update you on the status of the request.

204.description: Returns the stop call recording response.

post.summary: Pause recording the call.

202.description: The service has accepted the pause request and will begin processing it.

post.summary: Resume recording the call.

202.description: The service has accepted the resume request and will begin processing it.

get.summary: Get recording result. This includes the download URLs for the recording chunks.

CreateCallRequest.description: The request payload for creating the call.

sourceCallerIdNumber.description:
The source caller Id, a phone number, that's shown to the PSTN participant being invited.
Required only when calling a PSTN callee.

sourceDisplayName.description: Display name of the call if dialing out to a pstn number

source.description: The identifier of the source of the call

operationContext.description: A customer set value used to track the answering of a call.

teamsAppSource.description: The identifier of the source for creating call with Teams resource account ID.

customCallingContext.description: Used by customer to send custom calling context to targets

cognitiveServicesEndpoint.description: The identifier of the Cognitive Service resource assigned to this call.

backupCognitiveServicesEndpoint.description: A backup identifier of the Cognitive Service resource assigned to this call.

CustomCallingContext.description: The custom calling context which will be sent to the target

MediaStreamingTransportType.description: The type of transport to be used for media streaming, eg. Websocket

MediaStreamingContentType.description: Content type to stream, eg. audio

MediaStreamingAudioChannelType.description: Audio channel type to stream, eg. unmixed audio, mixed audio

AudioFormat.description: Specifies the audio format used for encoding, including sample rate and channel type.

startMediaStreaming.description: Determines if the media streaming should be started immediately after call is answered or not.

enableBidirectional.description: A value indicating whether bidirectional streaming is enabled.

TranscriptionTransportType.description: The type of transport to be used for live transcription, eg. Websocket

locale.description: Defines the locale for the data e.g en-CA, en-AU

speechModelEndpointId.description: Endpoint where the custom model was deployed.

startTranscription.description: Determines if the transcription should be started immediately after call is answered or not.

enableIntermediateResults.description: Enables intermediate results for the transcribed speech.

CallConnectionStateModel.description: The state of the call connection.

sourceCallerIdNumber.description:
The source caller Id, a phone number, that's shown to the PSTN participant being invited.
Required only when calling a PSTN callee.

sourceDisplayName.description: Display name of the call if dialing out to a pstn number.

correlationId.description: The correlation ID.

answeredBy.description: Identity of the answering entity. Only populated when identity is provided in the request.

mediaStreamingSubscription.description: The state of media streaming subscription for the call

answeredFor.description: Identity of the original Pstn target of an incoming Call. Only populated when the original target is a Pstn number.

AnswerCallRequest.description: The request payload for answering the call.

incomingCallContext.description: The context associated with the call.

customCallingContext.description: Used by customer to send custom calling context to targets when answering On-Behalf-Of call

operationContext.description: A customer set value used to track the answering of a call.

answeredBy.description: The identifier of the call automation entity which answers the call

RedirectCallRequest.description: The request payload for redirecting the call.

incomingCallContext.description: The context associated with the call.

target.description: The target identity to redirect the call to.

customCallingContext.description: Used by customer to send custom calling context to targets

RejectCallRequest.description: The request payload for rejecting the call.

incomingCallContext.description: The context associated with the call.

ConnectRequest.description: The request payload for creating a connection to a CallLocator.

operationContext.description: Used by customers to correlate the request to the response event.

CallLocator.description: The locator used for joining or taking action on a call

roomId.description: The Acs room id. (Not supported for Start Recording)

TransferToParticipantRequest.description: The request payload for transferring call to a participant.

targetParticipant.description: The identity of the target where call should be transferred to.

operationContext.description: Used by customers when calling mid-call actions to correlate the request to the response event.

transferee.description: Transferee is the participant who is transferred away.

operationCallbackUri.description:
Set a callback URI that overrides the default callback URI set by CreateCall/AnswerCall for this operation.
This setup is per-action. If this is not set, the default callback URI set by CreateCall/AnswerCall will be used.

customCallingContext.description: Used by customer to send custom calling context to targets

sourceCallerIdNumber.description: The source caller Id, a phone number, that will be used as the transferor's caller Id when transferring a call to a Pstn target.

TransferCallResponse.description: The response payload for transferring the call.

operationContext.description: The operation context provided by client.

playSources.description: The source of the audio to be played.

playTo.description:
The list of call participants play provided audio to.
Plays to everyone in the call when not provided.

playOptions.description: Defines options for playing the audio.

operationContext.description: The value to identify context of the operation.

operationCallbackUri.description:
Set a callback URI that overrides the default callback URI set by CreateCall/AnswerCall for this operation.
This setup is per-action. If this is not set, the default callback URI set by CreateCall/AnswerCall will be used.

PlaySourceType.description: Defines the type of the play source

playSourceCacheId.description: Defines the identifier to be used for caching related media

file.description: Defines the file source info to be used for play

text.description: Defines the text source info to be used for play

ssml.description: Defines the ssml(Speech Synthesis Markup Language) source info to be used for play

loop.description: The option to play the provided audio source in loop when set to true

interruptCallMediaOperation.description: If set play can barge into other existing queued-up/currently-processing requests.

interruptHoldAudio.description: If set, hold audio will be interrupted, then this request will be played, and then the hold audio will be resumed.

uri.description: Uri for the audio file to be played

text.description: Text for the cognitive service to be played

sourceLocale.description:
Source language locale to be played
Refer to available locales here: <seealso href="https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cognitive-services/speech-service/language-support?tabs=stt-tts" />

voiceName.description:
Voice name to be played
Refer to available Text-to-speech voices here: <seealso href="https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cognitive-services/speech-service/language-support?tabs=stt-tts" />

customVoiceEndpointId.description: Endpoint where the custom voice was deployed.

ssmlText.description: Ssml string for the cognitive service to be played

customVoiceEndpointId.description: Endpoint where the custom voice was deployed.

locale.description: Defines Locale for the transcription e,g en-US

speechModelEndpointId.description: Endpoint where the custom model was deployed.

operationContext.description: The value to identify context of the operation.

operationCallbackUri.description:
Set a callback URI that overrides the default callback URI set by CreateCall/AnswerCall for this operation.
This setup is per-action. If this is not set, the default callback URI set by CreateCall/AnswerCall will be used.

operationContext.description: The value to identify context of the operation.

operationCallbackUri.description:
Set a callback URI that overrides the default callback URI set by CreateCall/AnswerCall for this operation.
This setup is per-action. If this is not set, the default callback URI set by CreateCall/AnswerCall will be used.

RecognizeInputType.description: Determines the type of the recognition.

playPrompt.description: The source of the audio to be played for recognition.

playPrompts.description: The source of the audio to be played for recognition.

interruptCallMediaOperation.description: If set recognize can barge into other existing queued-up/currently-processing requests.

operationContext.description: The value to identify context of the operation.

operationCallbackUri.description:
Set a callback URI that overrides the default callback URI set by CreateCall/AnswerCall for this operation.
This setup is per-action. If this is not set, the default callback URI set by CreateCall/AnswerCall will be used.

interruptPrompt.description: Determines if we interrupt the prompt and start recognizing.

initialSilenceTimeoutInSeconds.description: Time to wait for first input after prompt (if any).

targetParticipant.description: Target participant of DTMF tone recognition.

speechLanguage.description: Speech language to be recognized, If not set default is en-US

speechRecognitionModelEndpointId.description: Endpoint where the custom model was deployed.

interToneTimeoutInSeconds.description: Time to wait between DTMF inputs to stop recognizing.

maxTonesToCollect.description: Maximum number of DTMF tones to be collected.

stopTones.description: List of tones that will stop recognizing.

endSilenceTimeoutInMs.description: The length of end silence when user stops speaking and cogservice send response.

operationContext.description: The value to identify context of the operation.

operationCallbackUri.description:
Set a callback URI that overrides the default callback URI set by CreateCall/AnswerCall for this operation.
This setup is per-action. If this is not set, the default callback URI set by CreateCall/AnswerCall will be used.

tones.description: List of tones to be sent to target participant.

targetParticipant.description: Target participant of send Dtmf tones.

targetParticipant.description: Participant to be held from the call.

playSourceInfo.description: Prompt to play while in hold.

operationContext.description: The value to identify context of the operation.

operationCallbackUri.description:
Set a callback URI that overrides the default callback URI set by CreateCall/AnswerCall for this operation.
This setup is per-action. If this is not set, the default callback URI set by CreateCall/AnswerCall will be used.

operationContext.description: The value to identify context of the operation.

GetParticipantsResponse.description: The response payload for getting participants of the call.

value.description: List of the current participants in the call.

nextLink.description: Continue of the list of participants

AddParticipantRequest.description: The request payload for adding participant to the call.

sourceCallerIdNumber.description:
The source caller Id, a phone number, that's shown to the PSTN participant being invited.
Required only when inviting a PSTN participant.

sourceDisplayName.description:
(Optional) The display name of the source that is associated with this invite operation when
adding a PSTN participant or teams user.  Note: Will not update the display name in the roster.

invitationTimeoutInSeconds.description:
Gets or sets the timeout to wait for the invited participant to pickup.
The maximum value of this is 180 seconds

operationContext.description: Used by customers when calling mid-call actions to correlate the request to the response event.

operationCallbackUri.description:
Set a callback URI that overrides the default callback URI set by CreateCall/AnswerCall for this operation.
This setup is per-action. If this is not set, the default callback URI set by CreateCall/AnswerCall will be used.

customCallingContext.description: Used by customer to send custom calling context to targets

AddParticipantResponse.description: The response payload for adding participants to the call.

participant.description: List of current participants in the call.

operationContext.description: The operation context provided by client.

invitationId.description: Invitation ID used to add a participant.

RemoveParticipantRequest.description: The remove participant by identifier request.

participantToRemove.description: The participants to be removed from the call.

MuteParticipantsRequest.description: The request payload for muting participants from the call.

targetParticipants.description:
Participants to be muted from the call.
Only ACS Users are supported.

operationContext.description: The operation context provided by client.

invitationId.description: Invitation ID used to add a participant.

MoveParticipantsRequest.description: The request payload for moving participant to the call.

operationContext.description: Used by customers when calling mid-call actions to correlate the request to the response event.

operationCallbackUri.description:
Set a callback URI that overrides the default callback URI set by CreateCall/AnswerCall for this operation.
This setup is per-action. If this is not set, the default callback URI set by CreateCall/AnswerCall will be used.

fromCall.description: The CallConnectionId for the call you want to move the participant from

MoveParticipantsResponse.description: The response payload for moving participants to the call.

participants.description: List of current participants in the call.

operationContext.description: The operation context provided by client.

fromCall.description: The CallConnectionId for the call you want to move the participant from

RecordingContentType.description: The content type of call recording.

RecordingChannelType.description: The channel type of call recording.

RecordingFormatType.description: The format type of call recording.

StartCallRecordingRequest.description: The request payload start for call recording operation with call locator.

callLocator.description: The call locator. (Only one of callLocator or callConnectionId to be used)

callConnectionId.description: The call connectionId. (Only one of callLocator or callConnectionId to be used)

recordingStateCallbackUri.description: The uri to send notifications to.

audioChannelParticipantOrdering.description:
The sequential order in which audio channels are assigned to participants in the unmixed recording.
When 'recordingChannelType' is set to 'unmixed' and `audioChannelParticipantOrdering is not specified,
the audio channel to participant mapping will be automatically assigned based on the order in which participant
first audio was detected.  Channel to participant mapping details can be found in the metadata of the recording.

channelAffinity.description:
The channel affinity of call recording
When 'recordingChannelType' is set to 'unmixed', if channelAffinity is not specified, 'channel' will be automatically assigned.
Channel-Participant mapping details can be found in the metadata of the recording.
///

pauseOnStart.description: When set to true will start recording in Pause mode, which can be resumed.

externalStorage.description: Optional property to specify location where recording will be stored

postProcessingOptions.description: The post processing options for the recording.

channel.description: Channel number to which bitstream from a particular participant will be written.

participant.description:
The identifier for the participant whose bitstream will be written to the channel
represented by the channel number.

RecordingStorageKind.description: Defines the kind of external storage

values.name: AzureCommunicationServices
values.description: Storage managed by Azure Communication Services

values.name: AzureBlobStorage
values.description: Storage managed by provided Azure blob

recordingDestinationContainerUrl.description: Uri of a container or a location within a container

cognitiveServicesEndpoint.description:
The identifier of the Cognitive Service resource assigned to the post recording processing.
The Cognitive Service resource will be used by the summarization feature.

transcription.description: Define options of the transcription for the post recording processing.

summarization.description: Define options of the summarization for the post recording processing.

enableTranscription.description: Determine if the Transcription should be enabled for the post recording processing.

enableSummarization.description: Determine if the summarization should be enabled for the post recording processing.

values.name: AzureCommunicationServices
values.description: Recording initiated by Azure Communication Services

values.name: TeamsCompliance
values.description: Recording initiated by Teams compliance policy

index.description: Chunks order in a multi chunk recording

label.description: Label is the primary identifier for the choice detected

recognizedPhrase.description:
